page.title: 19ST. LAURENCE'S CHURCH.
page.content: The{Church}was built sometime in the 12th or 13th Century erected on some high ground over looking a fine sweep of the{NENE.}From the church tower, without too much trouble, one can see{ {Castle Ashby}_ home of the Marquess of Northampton. The first known vicar of Brafield was{WILLIELMUS DE GRENDON}in 1281. Towards the end of the 17th Century the parishes of Brafield and Little Houghton were combined. In{1983}a competition was organised in conjunction with the{Church's {Restoration Programme}to see who could dig the fastest trench; the prize _{a {barrel of beer. } Repointing of the exterior still continues today. In May, 1984 a 3 day flower festival attended by{Morris Men with{craft stalls and competitions helped to swell funds.
